instruction: How did the study refine the existing lithological map of the Souk Arbaa Sahel region in southern Morocco using the support vector machine (SVM) approach and remote sensing data?

The researchers employed a supervised classification method considering SVM for lithological mapping. They utilized high-dimensional data, including combined spectral features of Landsat 8 OLI and digital elevation model (DEM) geomorphometric attributes of ALOS/PALSAR data. By applying the SVM algorithm, which is capable of defining non-linear decision boundaries in high-dimensional feature space, the researchers were able to classify and identify different lithological units in the region. The results of the SVM classification method showed an overall classification accuracy of 85%. The refined lithological map produced by this approach accurately identified formations such as silt, alluvium, limestone, dolomite, conglomerate, sandstone, rhyolite, andesite, granodiorite, quartzite, lutite, and ignimbrite, which coincided with the lithological units already existing on the published geological map. This demonstrates the effectiveness of the SVM approach and remote sensing data in refining and improving the lithological map of the Souk Arbaa Sahel region.
